Posts.Content: Very little information seems to be available about what to expect with radiation to the breast with RSD.  Physicians are mentioning brachytherapy 5 day and also traditional 30 treatment type, but state they don't know what will happen to the RSD. First RSD ini 2005 R. wrist after fall; then 2012 R. breast after overcompression before surgery; then again June 2014 during another surgery. Severe allodynia and pain has me bound to home for 33 days; meanwhile, I need to start some type of radiation.
Posts.Title: RSD in breast

Posts.Content: Any research you know of on those who have RSD in the breast re radiation side effects?  Thanks.
Posts.Title: Calling all alternative cancer treatments experiences...

Posts.Content: Hi.  I came out of the RSD pain in breast about 42 days after surgery.  Getting ready to take brachytherapy in breast, so I am told that the RSD will probably start up again due to nerve damage with catheter insertion.  Praying I get through it somehow without RSD.
Posts.Title: Calling all alternative cancer treatments experiences...

Posts.Content: My RSD had a definite event that started it in r wrist / a fall and fracture- and breast had an event - radiology compressed my breast so hard that it left a dark red straight line (blood under skin)which injured nerves.
Posts.Title: Calling all alternative cancer treatments experiences...

Posts.Content: Thanks for sharing.  Interesting perspectives.  I am now done with treatment 4 of 10 brachtherapy.  2 per day.  The catheter causes me some pain, so I take pain meds 1 hour before each treatment.   the incision where the catheter is sticking out of me is oozing and I am taking antibiotics to hopefully prevent infection.  I also am taking a probiotic 2 hours after the antibiotic.  Just three more days to hang in there.
Posts.Title: Calling all alternative cancer treatments experiences...

Posts.Content: Thanks. A nice nurse at American Cancer called tonight and she has tried to find info for me.
Posts.Title: Calling all alternative cancer treatments experiences...

Posts.Content: As I am facing radiation very soon, I wish I had read about laser surgery before my four lumpectomies and lymphadenectomy.  I have RSD aka Complex Regional Pain Syndrome in the right breast, caused by an injury at the radiology dept before going into surgery in 2012.  In 2012, it was only DCIS, so I declined radiation and tamoxifen, due to other health issues.  Now with 2 more lumpectomies and lymphadenectomy last month, my RSD (nerve damage producing disportionate jabbing and burning pain - misfire of the nervous system - severe allodynia where even a piece of silk is not tolerated - not even a breeze - I am confined to the house for 37 days; some improvement - but still unable to leave house or wear top clothing. My prospects for coming through radiation well with the RSD are not very good.  I feel like even with all of my research and asking questions, I don't get the whole story from any of my doctors.  They skirt over the side effects and possible complications and I need to know everything to weigh my risks.  I will live with the RSD forever, but added damage from radiation is another load I cannot bear right now.  I have to leave the house this week to talk to the radiation specialist and it is a very painful experience to wear my sheet cape and try to hold the sheet, as well as my damaged arm/underarm away, as well as hold the seatbelt away from me while someone drives me to the doctor.  Just needed to share.  Thanks.
